title: Playful pink Valentine proposal website for Astha (Yes-only interaction)

requirements.text: Create a single-page Valentine proposal website personalized for the name “Astha”, with all user-facing text in English and a consistently pink, playful, fun visual style (colors, typography, spacing, buttons, and backgrounds).

quotes: make me a website for valentine proposal for my girlfriend name astha make it in a pink way and make it playful and in a  fun way

acceptanceCriteria: The page prominently includes the name “Astha” in the main proposal content.
The UI uses a cohesive pink-forward palette and playful styling across all sections (not just the hero).
All visible text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement a proposal interaction flow that provides no effective way to deny the proposal: the UX must lead to a single successful outcome (“Yes”), and any attempted “No”/dismiss/close actions (if present) must not result in a denial state.

quotes: there will be no option for her to deny itt

acceptanceCriteria: There is a clear primary call-to-action that results in an explicit acceptance (“Yes”) success screen/state.
There is no reachable UI state that records or displays a rejection/denial outcome.
If a “No” element is included for playfulness, it cannot be used to complete a denial (e.g., it moves away, changes into “Yes”, or triggers a playful message and returns to the acceptance path).

requirements.text: Add a celebratory “Yes” success experience: a cute animation (e.g., hearts/confetti), a short romantic confirmation message, and an optional small follow-up prompt (e.g., “Pick our date idea”) that stays within the Yes-only flow (no rejection branches).

quotes: make it playful and in a  fun way that she will accept it

acceptanceCriteria: After acceptance, the UI shows a distinct success section/state with celebratory visuals.
The success state includes a confirmation message addressing Astha by name.
Any follow-up interaction does not introduce a rejection/denial path.

requirements.text: Add backend persistence to record when the proposal is accepted (timestamp + optional client-provided short note), and expose a query to retrieve the latest acceptance record (or total accept count) for display on the success screen.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the “Yes” action triggers a backend call that stores an acceptance record.
A backend query returns the stored acceptance data (at minimum: acceptance timestamp).
The success screen displays confirmation that acceptance was recorded (e.g., “Saved!” plus the time or a count).

requirements.text: Use generated static image assets to enhance the playful Valentine theme (background/hero illustration/stickers), and render them from frontend static assets (do not serve images via the backend).

quotes: make it in a pink way and make it playful and in a  fun way

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend.
At least one generated image is used in the hero area and one as a decorative/sticker element elsewhere on the page.

constraints: Use only the supported stack (React + TypeScript + Tailwind + React Query on the frontend; single Motoko actor on the backend).
Do not modify any frontend files in immutablePaths (compose UI using allowed files/components instead).
Do not add third-party auth providers; if auth is needed, only Internet Identity is allowed (but is not required for this build).
nonGoals: External integrations (social APIs, maps, email/SMS, real-time sockets).
A deny/reject outcome, rejection analytics, or any UX that allows completing a “No” flow.

required: Pink heart-pattern background with subtle gradients and sparkles (valentine-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
Cute cartoon heart character holding a small sign (heart-mascot.dim_800x800.png)
Set of 6 small playful Valentine stickers (hearts, roses, candies) on transparent background (valentine-stickers.dim_1024x1024.png)

preferencesToAdd: Visual style: pink, playful, fun Valentine theme.
miscToAdd: Interaction constraint: no effective option to deny; only acceptance outcome.
